column1: {"body": "The bullet ricochets off the man's helmet
column2:
prompting his comrade to yell: "You lucky son of a b****h."

Video loading

This extraordinary video shows the moment a US Marine is shot in the head by a Taliban sniper in Afghanistan - and lives to tell the tale.

The three minute
column5: follows three of the US Navy's elite amphibious infantrymen as they take part in a joint helicopter raid in Now Zad
column6: Helmand Province in 2013.\n\nAfter hearing insurgent gunfire
column8: pausing for cover in the exit of a tunnel.\n\nIt is at this moment that the marksman strikes
column9: a bullet from his high-powered weapon ricocheting off the helmet of the second Marine in the patrol with a loud crack.\n\nAfter some choice language
column10: the men beat a hasty retreat
column11:
warning colleagues that a sharpshooter has them in his sights.

Lucky escape: The Marine's ears are left ringing by the Taliban sniper's bullet

Once they are back under cover
column12: the Marine with the helmet camera says to his lucky colleague: \"Dude
column13:
you got shot.

"I saw it hit your Kevlar.

"You lucky son of a b***h."

The video was uploaded to YouTube by a user known as Sam Arnold.

To date it has been viewed more than 198
column16: "headline": "Video Messaging App Says Audio Recording Of Michael Brown's Shooting Is Authentic"

column1: {"body": "(Reuters) - A mysterious late-night blast in the Nicaraguan capital of Managua that left a crater 12 meters (40 feet) wide was most likely caused by a meteorite
column2: government scientists said on Sunday.\n\nThe loud explosion occurred around 11 p.m. on Saturday on the outskirts of Managua near the airport
column3: said Wilfried Strauch from the Nicaraguan Institute of Earth Studies (Ineter) in an interview on a government TV channel. No one was injured.\n\nStrauch said that Nicaragua is asking the United States for expert help to investigate the event
column4: which was picked up by seismic sensors.\n\n\"All the evidence that we've confirmed on-site corresponds exactly with a meteorite and not with any other type of event
column7: we have the seismic register which coincides with the time of impact
column8:
and the typical characteristic that it produces a cone in the place of impact."

Strauch said they had not been able to determine the composition of the supposed meteorite as they were not sure whether it had disintegrated on hitting ground or if it remained buried.

"We need to celebrate the fact that it fell in an area where
column10: it didn't cause any danger to the population
column11: \" Millan said.\n\nNicaragua has more than 20 volcanoes and is regularly shaken by earthquakes
column12: so many locals initially thought a quake caused the loud bang.\n\n(Reporting by Ivan Castro; Writing by Gabriel Stargardter; Editing by Eric Walsh)"
column14: "headline": "Nasa questions whether crater in Nicaragua caused by meteorite"

column1: {"body": "Welsh actor Christian Bale has withdrawn from the role of Steve Jobs in a forthcoming biopic of the Apple entrepreneur. According to The Hollywood Reporter
column2: Bale decided he \"was not right for the part after much deliberation and conflicting feelings.\"\n\nThe as-yet-untitled biopic
column3: which is coming out of Sony's studios
column4: has been written by The Social Network writer Aaron Sorkin and will be directed by Danny Boyle. In mid-October
column5: Sorkin announced Bale's involvement in a TV interview
column6:
explaining that the Batman actor didn't even need to audition.

Sorkin explained he had high hopes for Bale: "There isn't a scene or a frame that he's not in. So it's an extremely difficult part and he is gonna crush it."

The Sony film has been in progress since 2012 and was due to start filming this winter
column7: after former director David Fincher dropped out of the project in April over a pay dispute.\n\nBoyle is in LA this week to meet with the potential cast. Seth Rogen is said to be in discussions to play Jobs' colleague and Apple co-founder Steve Wozniak
column8: but no official announcments have been made."
column10: "headline": "CNN audio: Is this the moment Michael Brown was shot?"

column2: Nov 1 (Reuters) - A man claiming to be Boko Haram leader Abubakar Shekau said more than 200 girls kidnapped by the group six months ago had been \"married off\" to its fighters
column3: contradicting Nigerian government claims they would soon be freed. Nigeria's military says it killed Shekau a year ago
column4: and authorities said in September that they had also killed an imposter posting as him in videos. In the latest recording it is hard to see the man's face as he his filmed from a distance. But it is likely to raise grave doubts about whether talks between a Boko Haram faction and the government in neighboring Chad will secure the release of the girls
column5: who were kidnapped from a secondary school in Chibok
column7: in April. \"We have have married them off and they are all in their husbands' houses
column8: \" the man claiming to be Shekau says. \"The over 200 Chibok girls have converted to Islam
column9: which they confess is the best religion. Either their parents accept this and convert too or they can die.\" The majority of the kidnapped girls were Christians. The man in the video also denied there was a ceasefire
column11: who says he represents Boko Haram in Chad. \"Who says we are dialoguing or discussing with anybody? Are you talking to yourselves? We don't know anybody by the name of Danladi. If we meet him now we will cut off his head
column12: \" the man in the video says. \"All we are doing is slaughtering people with machetes and shooting people with guns ... War is what we want.\" He says also that they are holding a \"white man.\" The only known hostage seized in the northeast is a German teacher kidnapped from a college in the northeastern city of Gombe in July by gunmen widely assumed to be linked to Boko Haram. Shekau's denial of the ceasefire appears supported by the violence since the government announced it two weeks ago. It also raises doubts about the actual influence of Ahmadu. The five-year-old campaign for an Islamic state by Boko Haram
column13: which has killed thousands and whose name means \"Western education is sinful
column14: \" has become by far the biggest menace to the security of Africa's biggest economy and top oil producer. Its fighters have attacked targets almost every day for weeks and last week seized control of Mubi
column15: the home town of Nigeria's defense chief Air Chief Marshal Alex Badeh. It was Badeh who announced the ceasefire. They robbed banks
column16: burned down houses and hoisted their black flag over the Emir's palace
column17: killing dozens of people and forcing thousands to flee
column18: witnesses in Mubi said. A car bomb thought to have been planted by Boko Haram killed at least 10 people at a crowded bus stop in Gombe on Friday morning
column19: emergency services said. The government has blamed the violence on Boko Haram's allied criminal networks that it cannot control. There are also thought to be several competing factions within the group. (Writing by Tim Cocks; Editing by Louise Ireland)"
column21: "headline": "Nigeria Claims Boko Haram Will Release the Kidnapped Schoolgirls"

column1: {"body": "Boko Haram thinks all the truce talk is hilarious. At least that is what it seems like judging from a video released Friday to Nigerian media that purported to show the terrorist group\u2019s leader Abubakar Shekau laughing off claims that it had reached a ceasefire with the government and that the more than 200 girls the group kidnapped six months ago were close to being released. \u201cA lie
column2: \u201d Shekau said. \"We married them off. They are in their marital homes
column5: according to CNN. He then added that the girls converted to Islam and \u201chave now memorized two chapters of the Quran.\u201d In fact
column6: the whole issue about the kidnapped girls has been \u201clong forgotten
column8: Shekau said he had no idea whom the supposed negotiator was who supposedly worked out a cease-fire deal with the government on behalf of the Islamist group. \"We will not spare him and will slaughter him if we get him
column9: \" he said of the negotiator. He also threatened to kill a captured German hostage
column10: who is \u201calways crying.\u201d He added that the extremist group could \u201chack him or slaughter him or shoot him
column11: \u201d reports the Associated Press.\n\nThroughout the rambling speech
column14: \u201d talked about everything from the \u201cIslamic State to obscure Nigerian politicians to a threat to \u2018eat the heart of infidels
column15: \u2019 \u201d reports the Wall Street Journal. Yet more than what he said
column16: the mere release of a video is bad news for President Goodluck Jonathan
column17: whose administration had touted the cease-fire on the campaign trail. Jonathan is expected to win a second term in February."
column19: "headline": "Nigeria Says It Struck A Cease-Fire With Boko Haram
column20: But Are They Talking To The Right Guy?"

column1: {"body": "A blast near the Nicaraguan capital city of Managua on Saturday night was most likely caused by a meteorite plummeting to Earth
column2: creating a 40-foot-wide crater.\n\nA piece of the 2014 RC asteroid that passed close to Earth on Sunday
column5: no one was hurt.\n\nThe 60-foot-wide asteroid was passing 25
column6: 000 miles from Earth on Sunday but posed no danger to the planet
column7: NASA said.\n\nAuthorities have yet to determine whether the meteorite is buried or whether it disintegrated when it hit the ground. At first
column8: locals believed the blast was caused by an earthquake
column9: a regular occurrence in the country
column10: Reuters said.\n\n\u201cAll the evidence that we\u2019ve confirmed on-site corresponds exactly with a meteorite and not with any other type of event
column11: \u201d said Jose Millan of the Nicaraguan Institute of Earth Studies.\n\nThe explosion on the outskirts of Managua
column13: took place at around 11 p.m. and left a crater the size of a house.\n\n\u201cIt could have come off that asteroid because it is normal for that to occur. We have to study it more because it could be ice or rock
column15: a Nicaraguan volcanologist.\n\nCalling it a \u201cfascinating event
column18: said the country would work with the U.S. Geological Service to find out more about what happened

column1: {"body": "ISIS militants released gruesome video footage this afternoon of the beheading of American photojournalist James Wright Foley as a message to the U.S. to stop intervening in Iraq. Foley
column2: a freelancer who contributed to the Global Post
column3: was first captured in Libya in 2012
column5: and then kidnapped again around Thanksgiving 2012 by unidentified gunmen in Syria. He was 39 years old.\n\nThe (extremely disturbing) video can be viewed here. @Mujahid4life tweeted stills from it
column6: which are (aside from the one below)
column7: sickeningly graphic.\n\nThe Global Post reported the circumstances of his disappearance last year
column8: after attempting to keep the news quiet for fear of Foley's safety:\n\nFoley had set off toward the border in a car about an hour before his capture. A witness
column10: later recounted over the phone to a journalist in Turkey that an unmarked car intercepted Foley. The witness said men holding kalashnikovs shot into the air and forced Jim out of the car.\n\nThe witness said he noticed nothing that would indicate whether the aggressors were rebel fighters
column13:
or a religious-based group with other motivations.
He was held captive for 635 days.

In 2013
column14: Foley's family set up a Find James Foley website for him
column15: which states that he's the oldest of five children. His friend
column17: wrote about him for Syria Deeply last year:\n\nJim sees the good in nearly everything and everyone. He is a master motivator. \"You got this
column21: takes a liking to Jim as soon as they meet him."
column23: "headline": "ISIS Reportedly Beheads American Photojournalist in Iraq"

column1: {"body": "Seven girls aged between 13 and 14 have fallen pregnant after going on a school trip in Bosnia.\n\nFurious parents are demanding to know why there was such a lack of teacher supervision when the girls
column2: from the town of Banja Luka
column3: returned from a five-day trip to the capital city.\n\nThe school had taken 28 girls on the educational outing to Sarajevo to visit museums and other historical sitess
column4:
but since returning the girls have now reportedly dropped out of lessons.

Scroll down for video

The 28 schoolgirls were on a trip to the capital of Bosnia
column6: when seven returned pregnant\n\nThe case has provoked nationwide discussions about sex education in Bosnia
column7: where the number of sexually active girls aged between 13 and 15 has increased significantly.\n\nSenad Mehmedbasic
column8: a gynaecologist from Sarajevo said that a growing trend for underage pregnancies in Bosnia is worrying.\n\n'That is the trend of today. But we can not continue to allow our children to be educated about sex on the street and not in school
column9:
' he added.

He added that educational institutes and parents should play a stronger role in providing effective sex education.

'It is obvious that children do not have enough knowledge of health education so they engage in such activities
column10: not knowing the consequences.\n\n'We have to be more direct in the educational system
column11: it must not be allowed that street teaches children about intimate matters
column12: and that they are later slapped by life.'\n\nParents of the girls
column13: who are from the town of Banja Luka (pictured)
column14: are demanding to know why the teachers were not providing better supervision on the trip\n\nYoung girls in Bosnia are seeking advice from experts online
column15: the InSerba News Network has reported.\n\nOne schoolgirl wrote: 'I would have sex with my boyfriend
column16:
even though I'm only 14... But I am afraid I'll be judged.'

Last year in Sarajevo 31 underage girls became pregnant but seven out of 28 girls in one five day period has set something of a record.

The National Coordinator for Reproductive Health of the Republika Srpska
column18: admitted more children in his country are engaging in sexual relations as early as at age of 13 or 14.\n\nBut he didn't blame the teachers for the school trip pregnancy boom - he said it was down to 'parental neglect'."
column20: "headline": "Bosnia: Seven underage girls return from five day school trip

{"body": "Islamic State (ISIS) militants claim to have captured a supply bundle dropped by U.S. forces near the northern Syrian town of Kobani. Video posted to a YouTube channel associated with ISIS shows them rifling through packages containing dozens of grenades.

The supply package was apparently one of many intended for Kurdish fighters who have been battling ISIS militants for control of the strategically important town for weeks. The footage has not been independently verified.

According to Pentagon Press Secretary Rear Adm. John Kirby
column2: the majority of supplies were safely delivered to Kurdish forces
column3: which have been supported by a U.S.-led coalition as they defend the town. However
column4: Kirby said that at least one supply package may have fallen into the hands of the Islamic State.\n\n\"We are aware that one bundle was destroyed [via a video]
column5: \" said Kirby. \"Analysts are working as fast as they can to validate it.\"\n\nU.S. forces airdropped a total of 27 bundles containing weapons
column6: ammunition and medical supplies early Monday. The supplies were provided by Kurdish authorities.\n\nKobani
column7: located just yards from the Turkish border
column8: has been the scene of an intense battle between Kurdish forces and ISIS militants
column9: who attacked the area in late September.\n\nHave something to add to this story? Share it in the comments."
column11: "headline": "WATCH: Twitter catches fire amid rumors of Fidel Castro\u2019s death"
